wikipedia_page.main: Robert B. Potter (24 February 1950 – 12 April 2014) was a British academic geographer, focussing on urbanisation and development issues in the Caribbean. He was Emeritus Professor at the University of Reading, UK.

response: *Robert Potter (translator) (1721–1804), English translator, poet and cleric
*Robert Potter (Irish politician) (died 1854), Member of the UK Parliament for Limerick City
*Robert Potter (rugby union), rugby union player who represented Australia
*Robert Potter (American politician, died 1842) (c. 1800–1842), Congressional Representative from North Carolina, and later Texas Secretary of the Navy
